knowledge.heading: Collective Complicity in Tragedy
knowledge.description: The text reveals how entire communities can become complicit in tragedy through inaction, silence, or secret desires. Individual guilt becomes shared responsibility when everyone knows but no one acts to prevent the inevitable.
knowledge.pattern_connection: The journalistic distance of Investigative Fatalism allows objective examination of how collective behavior contributes to predetermined outcomes that individuals claim to regret.

device_examples.quote: she didn't warn him because she wanted them to kill him
device_examples.effect: Reveals hidden complicity disguised as maternal protection, showing how personal desires align with fatal outcomes.

device_examples.quote: We're going to kill Santiago Nasar
device_examples.effect: Documents the public nature of the threat, emphasizing community-wide knowledge and shared responsibility for inaction.
